page.title: 03Local History - Religion
page.content: Mohir Khan:- Our area of London is multi-religious. Catholics, Church of England Christians, Jews, Muslims and Hindus live side by side. Judaism returned to London in the mid-17th Century through the intercession of Oliver Cromwell. Also in the 17th Century the Huguenots, French Protestants exiled under the Edict of Nantes, came to London. They were particularly good Merchants and skilled weavers. They settled in East London and Spitalfields. In the 1960's other religions came to the area including Islam, Hindu, Buddhist and Tau. There are 76 churches, the oldest being St. Dunstan's, dating from the 15th Century; 12 Synagogues, including Bevis Marks built in 1701 & 5 mosques. The East London, costing 3m pounds is resplendant with minarets and a dome.
